revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Song | | Name = Just Like Strange Rain | Type = [[Song]] | Artist = [[Elton John]] | Album = [[Empty Sky]] (1995 reissue) | Cover = | track_no = 13 | Released = May 16, 1969 | Recorded = April [[1969 in music|1969]]
[[Olympic Studios]] | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Psychedelic rock]] | Length = 3:43 | Label = [[DJM Records]] | Writer = Elton John, [[Bernie Taupin]] | Producer = Steve Brown | prev = "[[It's Me That You Need]]" | prev_no = 12 | next = | next_no = }} "'''Just Like Strange Rain'''" is a song by [[Elton John]] with lyrics by [[Bernie Taupin]]. It was originally released as the B-side to his third single, "[[It's Me That You Need]]". It appeared as the last bonus track on the 1995 reissue of his first album ''[[Empty Sky]]''. ==Musical structure== The song opens with a loud electric guitar before segueing into the main verse. It is a steady R&B-beat accompanied by both [[hammond organ]] and [[piano]]. The song ends with the title being shouted several times over a [[Psychedelic music|psychedelic]] guitar solo. However, there is a certain "[[hymn]]"-feel over the song as with many of John's earliest. ==Lyrical meaning== Mentioning various colours and being about love it is one of the very few Taupin lyrics that's considered psychedelic. The use of words is very diverse. Words such as "Comic book" and "Embroidered" are very rare to find in the same lyric elsewhere. It was not performed anywhere at anytime and is not a popular pick among fans. ==Personnel== *Elton John - [[electric piano]], [[piano]], vocals *[[Caleb Quaye]] - [[Electric guitar|guitar]] *Tony Murray - [[Bass guitar|bass]] *Roger Pope - [[Drum kit|drums]] [[Category:1969 songs]] [[Category:Elton John songs]] [[Category:Psychedelic songs]] [[Category:Songs with lyrics by Bernie Taupin]] [[Category:Songs with music by Elton John]] [[it:Just Like Strange Rain]]
